intro: Andryala pinnatifida subsp. maroccana, commonly known as Moroccan flatleaf mallows, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its broad, pinnately divided leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
